Def.Name: Bebb Willow
Def.Description: Fast growing shrub or small tree. Grows to 10' - 20' tall with a trunk up to 6". May form dense thickets.
Def.Leaves: Alternate, simple, dull green, elliptical leaves 1" - 3" long, and 1/2" - 1 1/2" wide. May have almost smooth or very finely toothed margins with meshed viens and hairs.
Def.Twigs: Purpleish-red or Orange-brown with green/gray hairs.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Capsule with a beaklike point.
Def.Bark: Smooth, gray aquiring a rough texture with age.
Def.Range: Alaska, Canada and the northern United States, from Washington to Maine.
Def.Remarks: The wood of diamond Willow is great for carving and makes excellent canes.
